Record.Value: Gas Mixing
Practical Training: Stage IV
Extend your skills in the realm of gas mixing and filtration to create atmospheres, fuels and more.
Welcome Cadet! Deployed as a Stationeer, you'll need to create all manner of fuels and atmospheres for far-flung ODA bases. So let's explore your knowledge of gas filtering and mixing.

A Stationeer's work is never done, but your welder's out of gas! Time to create more fuel. First, you need a source of oxygen. Your plants make oxygen from CO2, and there's plenty of that in your suit waste tank. Just vent it in the hydroponics room.
Open suit waste tank
Close suit waste tank
In order to extract oxygen from the atmosphere in this room, build an active vent in the highlighted position. Use it to pump atmosphere to your filtration system.
Get active vent from crate
Build active vent in highlighted position
Now, leave your greenery alone for a moment. Move through the airlock to the atmospherics room to construct your gas mixing system.
Enter atmospherics room
To extract oxygen from the hydroponic room atmosphere, you need to reverse entropy. That's why the next step is building a filtration unit.
Get atmospherics kit from crate
Build filtration unit in highlighted position
To pass the hydroponic room's atmosphere into your filtration unit, complete the green oxygen pipe network.
Get pipes from crate
Complete oxygen pipe network

The filtration unit produces two things: usable gas and waste gas, which you should dispose of or loud, unpleasant things may happen. Connect the filtration unit's waste outlet to the waste network, so you can expel unwanted gas into the infinite void.
Get second pipe kit from crate
Complete the waste network
A filtration unit can filter out two gases simultaneously, but right now you just need oxygen to mix welder fuel. So add an oxygen filter in the unit.
Get oxygen filter from crate
Insert oxygen filter in filtration unit

To reduce the chance of your fuel accidentally igniting, it's a good idea to chill your gas. Many Stationeers learned this the messy way. To cool your pipes, run them outside and add pipe radiators, which disperse heat.
Get pipe radiator from crate
Add pipe radiator in highlighted position
The ice crusher is a good way to obtain gases from ice ores. Connect the ice crusher's gas output to the 'volatile' gas network.
Get ice crusher from crate
Build ice crusher in highlighted position
Use Iron Sheets on the Ice Crusher
Complete the Ice crusher with cables

The most commonly used Stationeer fuel has two components: oxygen and volatile gas. There's volatile ices in the mining belt in the crate. Add some to the ice crusher for processing. Note: volatiles sublime rapidly, but not inside the ore belt or crusher.
Get mining belt from crate
Add volatiles to ice crusher
To blend your fuel, you need to connect your oxygen and volatile networks using a gas mixer. Mixers let you set the correct ratio, avoiding the uselessness and disappointment of a bad mix.
Get gas mixer from crate
Build gas mixer in highlighted position
To make sure you don't overpressure your canister, add a pressure regulator - another important lesson for Stationeers who want to keep existing.
Get pressure regulator from crate
Build pressure regulator in highlighted position.
You don't want gases mixing until you're ready. So you need to open and close pipes using valves. We've placed one for you. Add another to your oxygen network.
Get the pipe valve from the crate
Place valve in highlighted position
To recharge a fuel cannister, put it in tank storage unit. These attach directly to pipe networks. Build one in the indicated spot.
Get tank storage unit from crate
Build tank storage unit in highlighted position
Excellent! Your gas network is now set up. Insert your welder's empty fuel canister into the storage unit, so it's ready for refilling.
Retrieve canister from storage unit
Insert welder fuel canister into tank storage unit
To find the correct gas mix ratio for fuel, consult the Stationpedia Canister (Fuel) page.
Set gas mixer valve to 66:34
Consult Canister (Fuel) page in Stationpedia
Close Stationpedia

Good, now set the pressure on the regulator. This will stop your canister from over-pressurizing and exploding. A safe pressure for canisters is 1950kPa, although they can tolerate up to almost 10MPa.
Set pressure on regulator to 1950kPa
Great work Cadet! Everything is ready. You can safely begin turning on your equipment to start producing fuel.
Hydroponics room: Turn on active vent
Turn on ice crusher
Turn on filtration unit
Turn on gas mixer
Turn on pressure regulator
The volatiles and oxygen are currently waiting paitently in the pipes. Open the valves to let them flow into through the gas mixer into your welder canister.
Open volatiles pipe valve
Open oxygen pipe valve
Stirling work, Cadet. Your fuel canister is now refilled. The ODA is relieved and impressed with your self-sufficiency. Insert the canister into your welder.
Return fuel canister to welder
Very promising, Cadet. The ODA will be gald to hear that you can be trusted to filter and mix combustible fuels. Excellent progress. Press the mysterious blue button to transmit your results.
Open suit UI
Select waste tank
Complete the airlock
You can now finish this room by completing the airlock with your fully refueled welder. Let's build!
Equip tablet from backpack
Insert Atmos Analyzer into tablet
Turn on tablet to scan gas pipes
Turn off tablet after scanning
Excellent. While the canister is filling, use your tablet to check that oxygen is entering the pipe. You'll need to insert the Atmos Analyzer, then hold the tablet over the pipe.
Hydroponics room: Set active vent to 'inward'
The ODA hereby acknowledges the bearer of this certificate possesses a level of fundamental proficiency in the disciplines of gas mixing and filtration.
